Biden Says the U.S. Will Not Supply Israel With Weapons to Attack Rafah

President Biden’s remarks reflected a growing rift between the U.S. and Israel over Gaza. He also acknowledged that American bombs had killed innocent Palestinians.

3 min read

Analysis

Turning Point or Breaking Point? Biden’s Pause on Weapons Tests Ties to Israel.

President Biden hopes the decision to withhold the delivery of 3,500 bombs will prompt Israel to change course in its war in Gaza.

6 min read

See a satellite view of Israel’s new front in Gaza.

Antiwar Protest Camp in Dublin Is Dismantled After College Agrees to Divest

Students against the war in Gaza began taking down the camp after Trinity College Dublin said it would divest from three Israeli companies.

3 min read

Prime Minister Rishi Sunak will talk to British university leaders about curbing antisemitism on U.K. campuses.

3 min read

The president of the University of Southern California was censured by the school’s academic senate after weeks of turmoil on campus.

3 min read

The Tiny Nation at the Vanguard of Mining the Ocean Floor

Below the waters of the Cook Islands, population 15,000, lie minerals used in electric cars. Extracting them could bring riches, but many say it’s a bad idea.

5 min read

A Guide to Eurovision 2024

This year’s edition of the international song competition takes place in Sweden. The run-up has been overshadowed by the conflict in Gaza.

5 min read

Johnson Survives Greene’s Ouster Attempt as Democrats Join G.O.P. to Kill It

Republicans and Democrats banded together to block a motion by Representative Marjorie Taylor Greene to remove House Speaker Mike Johnson.

6 min read

What Happens When a Happening Place Becomes Too Hot

City officials worked to make Milan attractive to visitors, but now that some neighborhoods are overwhelmed by rowdy crowds, they’re trying to scale back.

5 min read

Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Said a Worm Was in His Brain. How Does That Happen?

Experts explain the damage brain parasites can cause and how, exactly, such organisms get into people’s heads in the first place.

3 min read

Fencing Is Rattled by Suspensions and Accusations Ahead of Olympics

Concerns about refereeing integrity and preferential treatment for top saber competitors have cast a shadow over a sport decided by the finest of margins.

6 min read

Judge’s Decisions in Documents Case Play Into Donald Trump’s Delay Strategy

Judge Aileen Cannon has given sober consideration to arguments that some experts say should have been promptly dispensed with, leaving a backlog of pretrial issues.

5 min read

Here are the most memorable quotations from Donald Trump’s hush-money trial over the past seven days.

House Republicans Clash With Public School Leaders Over Antisemitism Claims

Politicians said educators had not done enough. But the New York chancellor said members were trying to elicit “gotcha moments” rather than stop antisemitism.

5 min read

The Great Read

Conner Mantz and Clayton Young had run side by side for more than 10,000 miles. Both vied for a place in the marathon at the Paris Games.
